Class BladeDuet

java.lang.Object
org.interworldtransport.cladosG.BladeDuet
public final class BladeDuet extends Object
This class serves two highly related purposes.
1) It supports blade discovery in blade multiplication by acting as a bucket for their generators that can be reduced using a signature.
2) It supports blade discovery in blade complement operations and compute the resulting blade's sign so it correctly multiplies to the pscalar in the basis that contains the input blade.

In Clados v1 the multiplication methods were all buried in the Basis and GProduct classes. BaldeDuet surfaces them in order to support parallelization of product table generation. As a side benefit, the complement operation supportual Dual() in Clados v2 also benefits from parallelization.

NOTE: BladeDuet makes use of streams, but intentionally avoids internal parallelization of computations. Most of what must be done must be in sequence. It is a calling objects that may parallelize operations relying on BladeDuet.

Version:
2.0
Author:
Dr Alfred W Differ

  • Field Details

    • bladeDuet

      protected ArrayList<Generator> bladeDuet
      This holds the combined list of generators from each blade. Left blade goes first, then right

    • sign

      protected byte sign
      This byte holds the sign of the blade to which the list of generators simplifies in the end. A +1 sign means a blade that is an even permutation of the remaining generators. A -1 sign means an odd permutation.
      Calculating the sign ALSO gets the algebra's signature involved, so this DOES involve the metric.

    • maxGen

      protected final Generator maxGen
      This is where the hint is kept for the largest possible blade in the basis to which the resulting blade actually belongs. It is capped by the maximum grade from one of the blades... which really should have the same maximum grade.

  • Constructor Details

    • BladeDuet

      public BladeDuet(Blade pB1, Blade pB2)
      This is a re-use constructor that builds this as a juxtaposition of the two offered blades.
      Parameters:
      pB1 - A Blade to re-use on the left.
      pB2 - A Blade to re-use on the right.

  • Method Details

    • complementLeft

      public static final Blade complementLeft(Blade pB1, byte[] sig, boolean pElliptic)
      This method takes the set of generators in the offered blade and returns a blade with a set of generators that complements the first in such a way that left multiplication of the initial blade by the complement blade produces the +pscalar associated with the initial blade.

      NOTE: Because generators might be degenerate, it is not possible to extract commute signs from the Cayley table when computing complement blades. If not for degeneracy, complement would involve a table lookup.

      Parameters:
      pB1 - Blade to be complemented with respect to it's basis pscalar blade
      sig - byte[] signature array to use when reducing duplicate generators
      pElliptic - True if degenerate pairs pretend to square to +1, False if they pretend to square to -1
      Returns:
      Blade complement of pB1 with sign set for left multiply returning +pscalar

    • complementRight

      public static final Blade complementRight(Blade pB1, byte[] sig, boolean pElliptic)
      This method takes the set of generators in the offered blade and returns a blade with a set of generators that complements the first in such a way that right multiplication of the initial blade by the complement blade produces the +pscalar associated with the initial blade.

      NOTE: Because generators might be degenerate, it is not possible to extract commute signs from the Cayley table when computing complement blades. If not for degeneracy, complement would involve a table lookup.

      Parameters:
      pB1 - Blade to be complemented with respect to it's basis pscalar blade
      sig - byte[] signature array to use when reducing duplicate generators
      pElliptic - True if degenerate pairs pretend to square to +1, False if they pretend to square to -1
      Returns:
      Blade complement of pB1 with sign set for left multiply returning +pscalar

    • simplify

      public static final Blade simplify(Blade pB1, Blade pB2, byte[] sig)
      This method reduces pairs of directions in what is ALMOST a sorted bladeDuet list. It's actually two buckets of sorted generators that upon duplication removal MIGHT be sorted. If not, we can jump straight to the sorted order simply by inserting the generators in an EnumSet which happens to be their destination in a Blade anyway. What we don't know immediately is how many transpositions are necessary to reach that sort order. That's what this method does after removing generator duplicates.

      The offered numeric signature is used for the reduction to handle sign flips. Generators with a positive square appear as a one (1) while those with negative squares appear as negative one (-1).

      NOTE that the numeric signature representation is a departure with prior use in Clados where zero(0) implied no sign flip and one(1) implied sign flip for negative squared generator. Prior practice used to add up the sign flips and then look at what was left modulo 2. Ideally, what we want is a 'signed bit' sized data element to track signs.

      Exception cases NOT checked because this is for CladosG internal use. The method itself is public, but it's really for internal use.

      Parameters:
      pB1 - Blade appearing on the left/row of a multiplication operation
      pB2 - Blade appearing on the right/column of a multiplication operation
      sig - signature array to use to reduce duplicate generators
      Returns:
      A fully reduced blade
